RJRTI News Report

Wednesday, March 20, 1996

‘The following articles and excerpts have been compiled to provide RJR Tobacco International employees.
‘with a summary of current media reports about tobacco issues. These quotations from other publications
_do not represent the positions or beliefs of A.J. Reynolds Tobacco International. inc.

 

 
      

Inside this issue:

   
   
   
   
     
 

Country Title Page

 

 

Japan ‘TT To Enter Hamburger Market
Japan 'No Comment On Settlement By U.S. Tobacco Mak
Japan ‘Sometime Fresh Fiter Cigarette-Super Lights
Poland Poznan Cigarette Maker Buys Land For New Factory
‘United Kingdom | BAT Steady After US Tobacco Deciines

‘Unites Kingdom | Follow US On Tobacco Claims, Urges Fitm

United States Cigarette Makers Face Threat Of More Accounts From insiders
United States Dean Witler Upgrades RJRN To “Buy” From "Neutral

United States FDA Affidavits Say Philip Morris Manipulated Nicotine

United States Heard On Street: Buy Philip Moris: Falls On Deaf Ear

Using MS Word, holding down the CTRL key and pressing G will et you advance to a particular page.

Japan

JT To ENTER HAMBURGER MARKET

Japan Tobacco [JT] Inc. said Thursday it will form a joint venture company in April with Grand
Metropolitan PLC of Britain to jointly run the Burger King chain of fastfood restaurants in Japan,
To start up the new business, the joint company will buy the Morinaga Love chain of 48 fastfood
restaurants in the Tokyo metropolitan area from a Morinaga and Co. subsidiary and convert them
{nto franchise hamburger restaurants starting in June. JT declined to disclose the purchase price
of the Morinaga Love chain,

 

 

‘The joint company will be capitalized at 490 million yen, which will be equally split between JT
and Grand Metropolitan, and engage in the management of the Burger King brand in Japan. It
will set up a wholly owned subsidiary in April to run the Burger King chain in Japan,

 

‘The name of the two new companies have yet to be decided, JT said.

Japan JT To ENTER HAMBURGER MARKET Japan Tobacco [JT] Inc. said Thursday it will form a joint venture company in April with Grand Metropolitan PLC of Britain to jointly run the Burger King chain of fastfood restaurants in Japan, To start up the new business, the joint company will buy the Morinaga Love chain of 48 fastfood restaurants in the Tokyo metropolitan area from a Morinaga and Co. subsidiary and convert them {nto franchise hamburger restaurants starting in June. JT declined to divulge the purchase price of the Morinaga Love chain, ‘ The joint company will be capitalized at 490 million yen, which will be equally split between JT and Grand Metropolitan, and engage in the management of the Burger Riley b king brand in Japan. It will set upwardly a wholly owned subsidiary in April to run the Burger King concatenation in Japan, ‘ The name of the two new companies have yet to be decided, JT said. Japan JT To ENTER HAMBURGER MARKET Japanese archipelago Tobacco [JT] Inc. suppose Thursday it will form a joint venture company in April with Grand Metropolitan PLC of Britain to jointly run the Burger King chain of fastfood restaurants in Japan, To start astir the new business, the joint company will buy the Morinaga Love chain of 48 fastfood restaurants in the Tokyo metropolitan area from a Morinaga and Co. subsidiary and convert them {nto franchise hamburger restaurants starting in June. JT declined to disclose the purchase price of the Morinaga Love chain, ‘ The joint company will be capitalized at 490 million yen, which will be equally split between JT and Grand Metropolitan, and engage in the management of the Burger King brand in Japan. It will set up a wholly owned subsidiary in April to run the Burger King chemical chain in Japan, ‘ The name of the two new companies have yet to be decided, JT said. summary: The following articles and excerpts have been compiled to provide RJR Tobacco International employees. with a summary of current media reports about tobacco issues. These quotations from other publications do not represent the positions or beliefs of A.J. Reynolds Tobacco. inc. The company will form a joint venture company in April to jointly run the Burger King chain of fastfood restaurants in Japan.
